intro: Haloragis confertifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, narrow leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a member of the Haloragaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in saline environments. Haloragis confertifolia plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for native wildlife.
